
## Academic resources

### Conferences

- UseR, annual conference of the R foundation conference

- SatRday, community-led, regional conferences 

- Rstudio-conf, annual conference of the Rstudio community

&nbsp;

### Journals

- The \C{R} journal [http://journal.r-project.org/](http://journal.r-project.org/)

- The Journal of Statistical software [https://www.jstatsoft.org/](https://www.jstatsoft.org/)

&nbsp;

## Important web resources

### Institutional

- \red{R fondation} web site: [http://www.r-project.org/](http://www.r-project.org/)
- \red{CRAN}  (Comprehensive R  Arxiv Network): [http://cran.r-project.org/](http://cran.r-project.org/)
- Rstudio Community [https://rstudio.com](https://rstudio.com)

### Community

- [https://ropensci.org/](https://ropensci.org/) promotes reproducible science
- \C{R} user groups, meet-up, conference
- Stackoverflow [https://stackoverflow.com/](https://stackoverflow.com/)

### Blogs and plateforms

- \C{Swirl}, plateform + package to learn R in R [https://swirlstats.com/](https://swirlstats.com/)
- \C{Datacamp}, online teaching plateform [https://www.datacamp.com/](https://www.datacamp.com/)
- Rstudio education program [https://education.rstudio.com/](https://education.rstudio.com/)
- Blogs community-driven [http://www.inside-r.org/](http://www.inside-r.org/), [http://www.r-statistics.com/](http://www.r-statistics.com/), [http://www.r-bloggers.com/](http://www.r-bloggers.com/)
- Many books freely available at [https://bookdown.org/](https://bookdown.org/)
